message.content:
cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG

The paper proposes an optimization algorithm for ridesharing, which involves real-time matching of passengers on general graphs. This problem can be categorized under multi-agent systems (cs.MA) as it involves multiple agents (passengers) interacting with each other to achieve a common goal (reducing overall overheads). The algorithm proposed also involves artificial intelligence (cs.AI) techniques to calculate the optimal waiting time for passengers. The problem can also be seen as a data structure problem (cs.DS) as it involves efficiently matching passengers on a graph. The optimization approach can be categorized under social and information networks (cs.SI) as it involves maximizing the number of partnerships while minimizing overheads. Finally, the algorithm proposed involves machine learning techniques (cs.LG) to learn from real-life data sets and improve the efficiency of the ridesharing system.
